g.text: The decibel scale expresses amplitudes and power values logarithmically. The definitions for these differ, but are consistent with eachother.

(7.1)Here power (s0) and amplitude (s0) represent a reference power and amplitude, respectively. Quantifying power or amplitude in decibels essentially means that we are comparing quantities to a standard or that we want to express how they changed. You will hear statements like "The signal went down by 3 dB" and "The filter's gain in the stopband is -60" (Decibels is abbreviateddB.).Exercise7.1.1The prefix "deci" implies a tenth; a decibel is a tenth of a Bel. Who is this measure namedfor?The consistency of these two definitions arises because power is proportional to the square ofamplitude:
(7.2)Plugging this expression into the Definition for decibels, we findthat
(7.3)Because of this consistency, stating relative change in terms of decibels is unambiguous. A factor of 10 increase in amplitude corresponds to a 20 dB increase in both amplitude and power!351
